title: How to Make Roasted Aubergine Soup

steps.headline: Cube aubergines and place in a large bowl of salted ice water.
Lay cubed aubergines on an aluminium-foil lined baking sheet.
steps.description: Drizzle over olive oil, then dust with sea salt, cinnamon, and cumin.

steps.headline: Place sheet in heated oven; bake for 35 minutes until cubes are soft and gooey.
Place a large soup pot over medium-high heat.
steps.description: Drizzle olive oil into the pot; heat the oil.

steps.headline: Add in the diced onion, garlic cloves, as well as a pinch of sea salt.
steps.description: Caramelize mixture, being careful not to burn it.

steps.headline: Pour in the cans of tomatoes, baked aubergine cubes, potato cubes, and vegetable stock over the caramelized garlic and onion.
steps.description: Dust with paprika, cayenne pepper, roasted garlic powder, and mint leaves, then stir thoroughly.

steps.headline: Lower heat to medium.
steps.description: Cover pot and simmer for 45 minutes.

steps.headline: Remove pot from heat at the 45 minute mark.
Emulsify/pureé soup to a thick consistency, using a hand blender.
Garnish with peppermint leaves and grated Parmigiano-Reggiano.

text: Cube aubergines and place in a large bowl of salted ice water. Let sit for 20 minutes. Preheat oven to 450° F (232° C).  Lay cubed aubergines on an aluminium-foil lined baking sheet. Drizzle over olive oil, then dust with sea salt, cinnamon, and cumin. Place sheet in heated oven; bake for 35 minutes until cubes are soft and gooey.  Place a large soup pot over medium-high heat. Drizzle olive oil into the pot; heat the oil. Add in the diced onion, garlic cloves, as well as a pinch of sea salt. Caramelize mixture, being careful not to burn it. Pour in the cans of tomatoes, baked aubergine cubes, potato cubes, and vegetable stock over the caramelized garlic and onion. Dust with paprika, cayenne pepper, roasted garlic powder, and mint leaves, then stir thoroughly. Lower heat to medium. Cover pot and simmer for 45 minutes. Remove pot from heat at the 45 minute mark. Let cool for 5 minutes. Emulsify/pureé soup to a thick consistency, using a hand blender.  Garnish with peppermint leaves and grated Parmigiano-Reggiano.  Finished.
